post_title: Startups Weekly: Big shake-ups at the AI heavyweights
title: Top Startups News Roundup: April 22-28
post_content:
Title: Startups Weekly Recap: April 22-28

Are you ready for a weekly recap of the most exciting startup news? Look no further than Startups Weekly. Here are the top stories of the week, plus some extra tidbits too.

1. Stability AI: The AI startup loses its CEO, Emad Mostaque, who has moved on to pursue decentralized AI. Mostaque was known for burning through cash faster than a teenager with their first debit card. The startup now has interim co-CEOs Shan Shan Wong and Christian Laforte.
2. Microsoft's acquisition of Inflection AI: Microsoft has snagged the co-founders and much of the staff of Inflection AI, along with the rights to use their tech, for a cool $650 million. The deal includes $620 million for the privilege of using Inflection's tech and an extra $30 million to ensure Inflection doesn't sue for Microsoft's bold talent grab.
3. Facebook's "Project Ghostbusters": Facebook was caught red-handed with its digital hands in the Snapchat cookie jar. Dubbed "Project Ghostbusters," Facebook's covert operation aimed to snoop on Snapchat's encrypted traffic, seeking to decode user behavior and gain a competitive edge.
4. Robinhood's new credit card: Robinhood unveiled its Gold Card, a credit card packed with features that just might make Apple Card users pause for a hot second. For the low, low price of being a Robinhood Gold member ($5 a month), you too can earn 3% to 5% cash back on everything.
5. Nvidia and AWS: Nvidia and Amazon Web Services might just be the tech world's accidental heroes, stumbling upon their core businesses like a toddler finding a hidden stash of cookies. AWS discovered it could sell its in-house storage and compute services, while Nvidia found its gaming GPUs were unexpectedly perfect for AI workloads.
6. Transportation troubles: The New York Stock Exchange has given EV startup Fisker the boot, citing its "abnormally low" stock prices. Shares plummeted over 28% in a single day, and Canoo, another EV hopeful teetering on the edge of viability, has been trying to cobble together a production line with Arrival's yard sale bargains.

Overall, this week has been full of interesting developments and news in the startup world. Be sure to tune in next time for another exciting edition of Startups Weekly.
meta_desc: Looking for the latest news and updates on startups? Look no further than Startups Weekly. We've got you covered with the top stories of the week, plus some extra tidbits too. Discover the latest on Stability AI, Microsoft's acquisition of Inflection AI, and more! Tune in now.

post_title: MIT tool shows climate change could cost Texans a month and a half of outdoor time by 2080
title: "Outdoor Days Lost by 2080: MIT Study"
post_content:
Introduction
Climate change has been a global concern for decades, and it's still a challenging concept to make relatable to the general public. However, a recent development by researchers at MIT might change that. They have created a tool that allows people to see how many "outdoor days" their region might experience from now through 2100 if carbon emissions growth remains unchecked. This tool could help us understand the impact of climate change on our daily lives and make informed decisions about the future.

Body
The MIT tool provides a relatable application of a field of study known as climate scenario analysis. This branch of strategic planning seeks to understand how climate change will impact various regions and demographics. The results of this analysis are alarming or comforting, depending on where you live. For people in California, France, and Germany, the climate will be a bit more clement in the spring and fall, adding anywhere from a few days to nearly a month of outdoor weather compared with historical records. However, some temperate places like New York, Massachusetts, China, and Japan will lose a week or more of outdoor days. Elsewhere, the picture looks even more dire. Illinois will lose more than a month of outdoor days by the 2080s as the summers grow unbearably hot, and Texas will lose a month and a half for the same reason.

The countries with some of the most vulnerable populations will suffer the most. Nigeria's summers will grow even hotter and longer, lopping off nearly two months of outdoor days. India will lose almost two and a half months. This analysis shows that the impact of climate change will be different for different regions and demographics.

The MIT tool is just one example of the many startups using the relatively newfound predictive capability of climate scenario analysis to help shape an uncertain future. Many of these startups are focused on tackling the uncertainty for investors, lenders, and insurers. Jupiter Intelligence, Cervest, and One Concern all focus on these markets, supplying customers with dashboards and data feeds that they can tailor to regions or even assets of interest. These startups also determine the risk of flood, wildfire, and drought and deliver reports detailing risk to assets and supply chains. They can also crank out regulatory disclosures, highlighting relevant climate risks.

Other markets exposed to the outdoors are also in need of
meta_desc:
a tool like MIT's to understand the impact of climate change on their operations. For example, a tool like this could help farmers understand how climate change will impact their crop yields and adjust their planting schedules accordingly. It could also help forestry companies understand how to mitigate the risks of forest fires and protect their investments. Numerous other industries, such as construction, transportation, and tourism, are also exposed to the outdoors and would benefit from such a tool.

As we continue to grapple with the global effects of climate change, it's essential to understand how it will impact our daily lives. By utilizing tools like MIT's, we can make informed decisions about the future and find ways to mitigate the negative effects of climate change.

Conclusion
Climate change is a significant challenge that we need to address head-on. By utilizing tools like MIT's, we can understand the impact of climate change on our daily lives and make informed decisions about the future. We need to find ways to mitigate the negative effects of climate change and ensure a safe and sustainable future for our planet. Start today by using tools like MIT's to understand the impact of climate change on your region and start planning for the future.

post_title: Instagram is developing 'Blend,' recommended Reels for you and a friend
title: Instagram tests 'Blend' feature for friends' Reels discovery
post_content: Instagram is currently testing a new feature called "Blend" that generates a personalized feed of Reels for you and a friend. The feature is similar to Spotify's "Blend," which allows two users to combine their favorite songs into one shared playlist. The screenshot of the feature shows that the Blend would be private between you and the other user, and you can leave a Blend at any time. Instagram hasn't shared any specific details about the feature, but it could help boost Reels' discovery and watch time by allowing users to discover new Reels together. The feature could give Instagram a slight competitive edge over TikTok, but it's unknown whether or not the feature will be released externally. If it is, Blend could be a fun and collaborative feature that sets Instagram apart from TikTok.
meta_desc: Discover InstaReels Blend: a unique, private Reels experience with friends. Join the fun, merge your worlds, and explore together!

post_title: Iron Sheepdog is fixing short-haul trucking from the bottom up
title: Revolutionizing Short-Haul Trucking with Iron Sheepdog's Intuitive Technology
post_content:
Title: Streamlining Short-Haul Trucking with Iron Sheepdog's Intuitive Technology

Introduction

Building simple yet effective technology can often prove to be a challenging endeavor. However, this is precisely what Iron Sheepdog aims to achieve, focusing on simplifying processes in the short-haul trucking sector. By fostering greater efficiency and transparency, the company seeks to revolutionize an industry traditionally characterized by opacity and inefficiency. In this article, we delve into Iron Sheepdog's offerings, its impressive funding round, and the unique strategy that sets it apart from the competition.

Addressing Pain Points in Short-Haul Trucking

Short-haul trucking typically involves outsourcing tasks to independent truckers arranged through brokers. To streamline operations, Iron Sheepdog provides user-friendly software designed to facilitate communication, tracking, and payment processing among all parties involved â€“ businesses, brokers, and truckers. Utilizing Iron Sheepdog's tools, businesses gain valuable insights into vehicle locations, job durations, and appropriate remuneration. Meanwhile, truckers benefit from an accessible application allowing them to effortlessly accept assignments and receive payments digitally.

Recent Funding & Growth

Earlier this week, Iron Sheepdog secured a significant milestone by raising a $10 million Series B funding round headed by SJF Ventures, along with contributions from Grand Ventures, Supply Chain Ventures, and strategic partners. According to Mike Van Sickel, Iron Sheepdog's CEO and co-founder, the initial years were dedicated to ensuring client acceptance and financial stability. With these objectives met, the company is poised to expand its footprint in the marketplace.

Prioritizing Trust & Adoption

A crucial factor in achieving widespread adoption revolves around trust. As Van Sickel explains, "the most vital aspect is getting the subhauler to actively use the app." Many competing platforms encounter resistance due to mandatory usage imposed upon truckers, resulting in increased complications. Leveraging personal experiences, Iron Sheepdog's founders recognized the need for a straightforward, reliable solution catering specifically to short-haul truckers. Consequently, the team focused on developing a basic yet powerful tool tailored to this niche demographic, enticing users with the promise of prompt payment.

This targeted strategy proved successful, leading to consistent annual growth for Iron Sheepdog. Rather than concentrating solely on wooing contractors, the firm opted for a bottom-up approach, initially prioritizing the needs of short-haul truck drivers. A user-friendly smartphone application combined with a guarantee of daily pay incentivized truckers to join the platform, setting off a ripple effect throughout the supply chain. Brokers followed suit, eager to connect with the expanding pool of available talent. Simultaneously, contractors expressed interest in joining the burgeoning network, recognizing its potential benefits.

Capitalizing on Network Effects

As Iron Sheepdog amasses a sizeable user base comprising brokers and truckers, businesses stand to gain considerably from enhanced resource utilization. Increased visibility enables enterprises to assign multiple tasks to individual trucks, thereby decreasing overall fleet requirements while simultaneously cutting emissions. Furthermore, optimized scheduling facilitated by real-time data ensures maximum productivity.

Industry Landscape & Competition

Interestingly, investments in construction technology startups have surged recently; however, innovation surrounding transport logistics remains relatively scarce. Most technological advancements emphasize automation and improved efficiencies within job sites, neglecting the critical role transportation plays in project execution. Additionally, emerging firms primarily concentrate on constructing self-driving vehicles or addressing last-mile delivery challenges. Iron Sheepdog distinguishes itself by dedicating resources towards enhancing dump truck management and related functions, filling a gap left by others in the marketplace.

Conclusion

With increasing demand for specialized construction technology solutions, Iron Sheepdog stands out as a promising innovator in the field. Focusing on underdeveloped areas such as short-haul trucking management, the firm successfully bridges gaps in operational efficiency and transparency. Boasting a steadfast commitment to user-centric design, Iron Sheepdog continues to grow, solidifying its position as a leader in the industry.
meta_desc:
Title: Iron Sheepdog: Revolutionizing Short-Haul Trucking with Intuitive Technology

Meta Description: Streamline your short-haul trucking operations with Iron Sheepdog's easy-to-use software designed for businesses, brokers, and truckers. Discover how Iron Sheepdog is transforming an opaque industry with trust-based solutions and real-time data. Click now to learn more!

title: BiaTech Joins NVIDIA Inception: Revolutionizing Energy and Natural Resource Infrastructure with AI Toolkit
post_content:
Tampa, FL - March 29, 2024 - BiaTech Corporation announced its membership in NVIDIA Inception, a program that supports startups revolutionizing industries with cutting-edge technology.

BiaTech Corporation is a multisensory AI fusion startup that specializes in immersive experiences for Energy and Natural Resource infrastructure. The company aims to create the trillion-dollar industries of tomorrow by combining sensors that replicate sight, hearing, and smell to create semi-sentient infrastructure. BiaTech's products include AI-powered asset protection from wildfires and live monitoring of energy flow in a 3D visual environment for geothermal and utilities.

BiaTech's focus is on AI-enabled edge and cloud technology for clean energy and utility measurement and monitoring. The company helps clients increase productivity and extend asset life. Currently, BiaTech is developing an AI solution for geothermal pipeline flow measurement, supported by a US Department of Energy grant, and AI utility solutions for fire detection and vegetation management with computer vision.

Joining NVIDIA Inception will enable BiaTech to accelerate its product development from prototype to commercial readiness. The program offers benefits such as product developer training, preferred pricing on NVIDIA hardware and software, cloud credits, and access to NVIDIA's investor network for its current pre-seed funding round. BiaTech will also collaborate with industry-leading experts and other AI-driven organizations.

"Becoming a member of NVIDIA Inception is a crucial step for us as we transition from ideation to building a business that the world needs now," said Nathaniel Hartwig, Founder and CEO of BiaTech Corporation. "This is about helping clients bring affordable clean energy to everyone by leveraging our innovative AI toolkit, now available. BiaTech is collaborating with NVIDIA to create the trillion-dollar industries of tomorrow."

NVIDIA Inception supports startups during critical stages of product development, prototyping, and deployment. Each member receives a custom set of ongoing benefits, such as NVIDIA Deep Learning Institute credits, preferred pricing on NVIDIA hardware and software, and technology assistance, which provides startups with the fundamental tools to help them grow.

For more information about BiaTech Corporation, visit www.BiaTech.com.

Contact:
Robert Alford
BiaTech Corporation

+1(713)818-4483

post_title: Women in AI: Kate Devlin of King's College is researching AI and intimacy
title: "Kate Devlin: AI and Society"
post_content:
Women have long been underrepresented in the tech industry, including in the field of artificial intelligence (AI). To give them their rightful recognition, TechCrunch is launching a series of interviews that highlight remarkable women who have made significant contributions to the AI revolution. In this blog post, we will profile Kate Devlin, a lecturer in AI and society at King's College London and the author of "Turned On: Science, Sex and Robots."

Kate Devlin's work explores the ethical and social implications of technology and intimacy. She directs advocacy and engagement for the Trusted Autonomous Systems Hub, a collaborative platform that supports the development of "socially beneficial" robotics and AI systems. Devlin is also a board member of the Open Rights Group, an organization that works to preserve digital rights and freedoms.

In the following interview, Devlin shares her insights on the challenges and opportunities facing the AI industry and offers advice to women seeking to enter the field.

Q&A

Q What attracted you to the field of AI?

A I started out as an archaeologist and eventually completed a Ph.D. in computer science. I was interested in exploring how people interact with and react to technologies, past and future. My research in this area eventually led me to the field of AI.

Q What work are you most proud of (in the AI field)?

A I'm pleased that intimacy and AI is now taken seriously as an academic area of study. There's amazing research being done in this area, and it's great to see people forming meaningful relationships with chatbots.

Q How do you navigate the challenges of the male-dominated tech industry, and, by extension, the male-dominated AI industry?

A I don't focus on those challenges. We just persevere. It's still sexist, but it's important to keep pushing forward and working towards change.

Q What advice would you give to women seeking to enter the AI field?

A Don't be afraid to take up as much space as the men. You have the right to contribute to this field just as much as they do.

Q What are some of the most pressing issues facing AI as it evolves?

A Responsibility and accountability are key issues. As AI technology continues to advance, it's important that we ensure that it is used ethically and responsibly.

Q What are some issues AI users should be aware of?

A One important issue to be aware of is the provenance of the data being used to train AI systems. It's important to consider the ethics and social responsibility of the providers of this data.

Q What is the best way to responsibly build AI?

A Responsibility and conscience are the keys to responsibly building AI. It's important to consider the potential impact of AI on society and to work towards building systems that are ethical and beneficial.

Q How can investors better push for responsible AI?

A Investors can push for responsible AI by prioritizing social impact and sustainability in their investment decisions. They can also work with companies to ensure that they are considering these factors in their AI supply chains.

Conclusion

Kate Devlin's work in the field of AI and society is essential for ensuring that this technology is developed and used in a responsible and ethical manner. As more women enter the field and take up space in the tech industry, we can work towards a more diverse and inclusive future for AI. By prioritizing responsibility and conscience in our approach to AI, we can ensure that this technology is used to benefit society as a whole.
meta_desc: AI and society are becoming increasingly intertwined, and Kate Devlin is at the forefront of this movement. As a lecturer in AI and society at King's College London, she advocates for ethical and socially beneficial robotics and AI systems. Devlin's work explores the intersection of technology and intimacy, and she is a board member of the Open Rights Group, which works to preserve digital rights and freedoms. In this interview, Devlin shares her insights on the challenges and opportunities facing the AI industry and offers advice to women seeking to enter the field.
focuskeywords: The keyphrase for this news article is "AI and society."

title: Voice Cloning: OpenAI Unveils AI-Powered Tool with Ethical Safeguards
post_content:
Title: The Looming Threat of AI-Generated Voice Deception and OpenAI's Cautious Approach

In an era where artificial intelligence (AI) continues to shape our world, concerns regarding its potential misuse have become increasingly urgent. OpenAI, a leading AI research organization, has recently unveiled its voice-cloning tool, named "Voice Engine," which can mimic a person's voice based on a mere 15-second audio sample. However, recognizing the significant risks associated with this technology, OpenAI has decided to maintain strict control over its release until adequate safeguards are in place to prevent audio deepfakes and misleading manipulations.

Disinformation researchers have been raising alarms about the widespread misuse of AI-powered applications, particularly in a critical election year. Voice cloning tools have become both inexpensive and effortless to use, making them increasingly difficult to trace. As a result, the risk of AI-generated deepfake disinformation flooding the 2024 US presidential race and other crucial elections worldwide is more imminent than ever.

In light of these concerns, OpenAI has opted for a cautious approach, acknowledging the necessity for thorough consideration before making Voice Engine available to the general public. This decision comes after a political consultant working for a Democratic rival to Joe Biden admitted to orchestrating a robocall that impersonated the US president. The AI-generated call, designed by an operative for Minnesota congressman Dean Phillips, used a fake Biden voice urging people not to vote in the New Hampshire primary.

To ensure ethical usage, OpenAI has established partnerships with various organizations, including government entities, media corporations, educational institutions, and civil society groups. These partners have agreed to several rules, such as obtaining explicit and informed consent from any individual whose voice is duplicated using Voice Engine and making it clear to audiences when they are listening to AI-generated voices.

Additionally, OpenAI has implemented several safety measures, such as watermarking to trace the origin of any audio generated by Voice Engine and proactively monitoring its use. The ultimate goal is to create a safe and responsible environment for the deployment of this groundbreaking technology while minimizing the risk of AI-generated voice deception.

The development and eventual release of such powerful voice-mimicking tools highlight the importance of establishing robust guidelines and safeguards to protect individuals and societies from potential misuse. By engaging with various stakeholders and implementing stringent measures, OpenAI sets a positive example for other AI research organizations to follow, ensuring that innovation is met with responsibility and care.

With the 2024 US presidential race on the horizon, it is crucial for technology companies, policymakers, and the general public to remain vigilant and proactive in addressing the challenges posed by AI-generated voice deception. By fostering a dialogue centered on transparency, ethics, and collaboration, we can collectively build a future where AI serves as a tool for progress, rather than a source of manipulation and deceit.
meta_desc:
Title: The Looming Threat of AI-Generated Voice Deception and OpenAI's Cautious Approach

Meta Description: Recognizing the risks associated with AI-powered voice cloning tools, OpenAI is taking a cautious approach to ensure ethical usage and prevent audio deepfakes and misleading manipulations during the 2024 US presidential race and other crucial elections worldwide. Join the conversation on transparency, ethics, and collaboration to build a future where AI serves as a tool for progress.
focuskeywords: openai, voice-cloning, AI, AI-generated, deepfake, disinformation, election, 2024 US presidential race, ethics, responsibility.

post_title: Can generative AI help address the cybersecurity resource gap?
title: AI for Cybersecurity: Addressing the Resource Gap and Improving Organizational Security Communications
post_content:
Security teams are under immense pressure to protect organizations from cyber threats, but they often struggle to find, hire, and maintain the talent they need to do the job effectively. The shortage of cybersecurity professionals is a growing concern, with ISC2 reporting that the industry is experiencing a nearly 4 million person workforce shortage. While this shortage is a challenge, generative AI can help address it and have a positive impact on cybersecurity. In this blog post, we will explore how generative AI can be used to lower the bar to entry, create more user-friendly documentation, reduce the risk of burnout, and improve cross-team organizational security communications.

Join us in Atlanta on April 10th and explore the landscape of security workforce. We will explore the vision, benefits, and use cases of AI for security teams. Request an invite here.
meta_desc:
to get started with a new tool or solution. This can save time and allow for more effective onboarding.

Generative AI can also help reduce the risk of burnout for cybersecurity professionals. With the rise of the 24/7 cybersecurity threat landscape, it's become increasingly challenging to keep up with the constant barrage of threats and vulnerabilities. Generative AI can be used to automate repetitive tasks, such as threat intelligence feed analysis and vulnerability scanning, which can free up cybersecurity professionals to focus on more strategic tasks.

Finally, generative AI can improve cross-team organizational security communications. With the increasing number of security teams in organizations, it can be difficult to keep everyone on the same page. Generative AI can be used to process and distill complex information into something very precise and meaningful for the user. This can help teams to understand and align on the same security posture, improving overall security posture.

Join us in Atlanta on April 10th and explore the landscape of security workforce. We will explore the vision, benefits, and use cases of AI for security teams. Request an invite here.

post_title: Nine crypto VCs on why Q1 investments were so hot and how it compares to previous bull market
title:
Crypto VCs on Q1 Investments and How it Compares to Previous Bull Market

2024 Q1 saw $2.52 billion raised in crypto and blockchain sectors, a 25% increase from Q4 2023. Over 690 deals transpired during this period, with institutional interest playing a significant role.
post_content:
Crypto VCs on the Hot Q1 Investments and How it Compares to Previous Bull Market

2023 may have been a challenging period for crypto venture capital fundraising, but Q1 of 2024 is heating up, with $2.52 billion raised across the crypto and blockchain sectors. This is about 25% higher than the fourth quarter of 2023, with over 690 deals across stages transpiring during Q1.

According to Tom Schmidt, a partner at Dragonfly Capital, the crypto venture capital funding landscape in Q1 was cautiously optimistic, rebounding from a challenging two-year period. David Nage, portfolio manager at Arca, says he has tracked over 690 deals across stages that have transpired during Q1, about 30 to 40% more than the lows in 2023.

So, what's driving the surge in Q1 investments? Positive effects from legal wins last year from Ripple and Grayscale, positive sentiments around decentralized finance (DeFi) on Solana, and demand for Bitcoin ETFs in the US have all contributed. Additionally, the market didn't die as expected, which is a positive sign for the future.

Macro validation from crypto is also playing a significant role in heating up the crypto venture capital landscape. The launch of crypto ETF products, the Bitcoin halving, projected rate cuts in the US ahead of the upcoming presidential election, and institutional interest converting into real budgets and products are all contributing to the bullish macro backdrop fueling the crypto venture capital market.

One example of institutional interest is BlackRock launching its tokenized tokenized money market fund on the Ethereum blockchain, which could lead to heightened competitive pressure from traditional financial institutions and more adoptions.

In terms of deal flow, the crypto startup market has picked up in areas ranging from DeFi to SocialFi to Bitcoin layer-2 growth. While there has been an uptick in both new companies coming to market and existing companies revisiting fundraising, the market in 2024 will be a tale of the 'haves' and 'have nots,' with newer companies building along popular narratives getting funded at rich valuations and many others going out of business.

SocialFi and Web3 gaming are currently very hot sectors, with success stories like Bi.social's $3 million round and Mask Network's $100 million fund to support other similar applications. Modular and AI-integrated blockchains, like 0G labs, are also attracting the attention of venture capitalists.

Competitiveness among VCs is creating an environment in which founders have greater leverage in fundraising, with investors reverse-pitching their value and founders having optionality and the ability to set terms. However, while the power may have shifted slightly from investors to founders, it is "perfectly balanced" and will continue to be so in the near future.

In conclusion, the crypto venture capital market in Q1 of 2024 is heating up due to a combination of factors, including positive legal wins, positive sentiment around DeFi, and institutional interest. While there are still challenges to overcome, the future looks bright for the crypto and blockchain sectors, with continued growth and innovation on the horizon.
meta_desc: Meta Description: Learn about the surge in Q1 crypto venture capital investments in 2024 and how it compares to the previous bull market. Get insights from industry experts and discover the driving factors behind the bullish macro backdrop.
focuskeywords: Crypto VCs on Hot Q1 Investments and Bull Market

post_title: Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis gets UK knighthood for 'services to artificial intelligence'
title: Demis Hassabis knighted for contributions to AI
post_content: Demis Hassabis, CEO and one of the three founders of Google's AI subsidiary DeepMind, has been awarded a knighthood in the U.K. for "services to artificial intelligence." He was born in London in 1976 and emerged as a prodigy in various fields, including chess, computer science, and cognitive neuroscience. Hassabis founded DeepMind with Shane Legg and Mustafa Suleyman, and their company has been at the forefront of AI innovation, developing an AI system that beat the world champion of strategy board game Go. The U.K. has made significant investments in AI R&D, and Hassabis's knighthood is a testament to his contributions to the field. Other notable figures from the technology world to receive knighthoods include Apple's Jonathan "Jony" Ive.

post_title: An optimization-based method to enhance autonomous parking
title: Title: OCEAN: Revolutionizing Autonomous Parking with Optimization-based Planning
post_content:
Title: Revolutionizing Autonomous Parking with OCEAN: An Openspace Collision-free Trajectory Planner

Autonomous vehicles have long been a fascinating goal for both the robotics research community and the automotive industry. Although many companies have invested in and tested self-driving cars, they have only been deployed in limited settings. A particular area of interest in this field is the concept of automated valet parking (AVP), which enables a car to drive itself from a parking entrance to an available parking spot without human intervention. This application has garnered significant research attention, but its reliable implementation has proven to be challenging.

Researchers from Mach Drive in Shanghai have recently developed OCEAN (Openspace Collision-freE trAjectory plaNner), an optimization-based trajectory planner designed for autonomous parking. The researchers introduced OCEAN in a pre-published paper on arXiv, showcasing its ability to enhance the safety and efficiency of cars parking without collisions.

Traditional autonomous parking approaches have struggled with accurately predicting collisions and performing well in real-time tests. OCEAN addresses these issues by improving upon a previously proposed method called Hybrid Optimization-based Collision Avoidance (H-OBCA). This innovative planner overcomes H-OBCA's limitations, ultimately improving its ability to avoid collisions, robustness, and speed in real-time scenarios.

OCEAN's design starts with a hierarchical optimization-based collision avoidance framework. It first initializes the trajectory planning problem with a collision-free Hybrid A trajectory. Then, the collision avoidance trajectory planning problem is reformulated as a smooth and convex dual form, which is solved by the Alternating Direction Method of Multipliers (ADMM) in parallel. The optimization variables are carefully split into several groups, ensuring that the ADMM sub-problems can be efficiently and robustly solved as Quadratic Programming (QP), Sequential Quadratic Programming (SQP), and Second Order Cone Programming (SOCP) problems.

The researchers tested OCEAN in hundreds of simulated scenarios and conducted real-world experiments in public parking areas. The results demonstrated that OCEAN outperformed various autonomous parking methods, making it a promising solution for large-scale parking planners on low computing power platforms requiring real-time performance.

In summary, OCEAN represents a significant leap forward in autonomous parking technology. With further improvements and real-world testing, this innovative planner could be deployed by automotive companies, paving the way for the widespread introduction of automated vehicle parking technologies.

Reference: Dongxu Wang et al., OCEAN: An Openspace Collision-free Trajectory Planner for Autonomous Parking Based on ADMM, arXiv (2024). DOI: 10.48550/arxiv.2403.05090

post_title: Simultaneous performance improvement and energy savings with an innovative algorithm for 6G vision services
title: Revolutionize 6G Vision Services with VisionScaling: A Game-Changing Integrated Learning Model and Resource Optimization Technology
post_content:
Title: Unleashing the Power of 6G Vision Services with VisionScaling: A Revolutionary Optimization Technology

Introduction

In the era of 6G, mobile vision services are becoming increasingly popular, offering innovative technologies such as augmented reality (AR) and autonomous driving. These services, however, require high-performance processors and accurate learning models to efficiently capture and understand video and image content. To address this challenge, Professor Jeongho Kwak from the Department of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science at DGIST has developed an integrated learning model and resource optimization technology called VisionScaling. This article delves into the fascinating world of 6G vision services and how VisionScaling is set to revolutionize the field.

The Challenge: Balancing Accuracy and Efficiency

The high computing power and complex learning models required by 6G vision services often lead to inefficient resource utilization on mobile devices. Traditional technologies have treated learning models and computing/networking resources as separate entities, resulting in suboptimal performance and energy consumption. To tackle this problem, Professor Kwak's team focused on simultaneously optimizing learning models and computing/networking resources in real time.

VisionScaling: A Game-Changing Solution

Professor Kwak's team has proposed VisionScaling, a new integrated learning model and computing/networking optimization algorithm. This groundbreaking algorithm reduces energy consumption by at least 30% while maintaining average accuracy compared to current technologies, without compromising on average target accuracy or time delay. By adapting to constantly changing mobile environments, VisionScaling maintains optimal performance through the use of 'Online Convex Optimization (OCO),' a cutting-edge learning technique.

Real-World Impact: Energy Savings and Improved Latency

The research team has implemented and tested VisionScaling in a real-world mobile vision service environment using embedded AI devices and connected edge computing platforms. The results are impressive: a 30% reduction in energy consumption in mobile devices and a 39% improvement in end-to-end latency compared to previously used algorithms.
meta_desc: Looking to enhance your 6G vision services? Learn how VisionScaling, an integrated learning model and optimization technology developed by Professor Jeongho Kwak at DGIST, can help you balance accuracy and efficiency. Discover how this groundbreaking algorithm reduces energy consumption by at least 30% while maintaining optimal performance in real-time. Unlock the full potential of 6G vision services with VisionScaling.

post_title: The AI world needs more data transparency and web3 startup Space and Time says it can help
title: Web3 Startup Space and Time uses ZK proofs to verify data and combat data manipulation
post_content:
The world of AI is becoming increasingly complex, with data manipulation becoming more prevalent and difficult to detect. This is where web3 startup Space and Time comes in, offering a solution through the use of verification and zero-knowledge proofs (ZK proofs). ZK proofs are a cryptographic action that can be used to prove something about a piece of information without revealing the origin data itself.

Space and Time's approach is to be a verifiable computing layer for web3, indexing data both off-chain and on-chain. This allows for efficient and accurate verification of data, and the startup has already indexed data from major blockchains like Ethereum, Bitcoin, and Avalanche. They are also adding support for more chains to power the future of AI and blockchain technology.

Scott Dykstra, CTO and co-founder of Space and Time, sees the need for this solution in the financial industry, as well as in other industries where manipulation of data is becoming more common. He notes that financial institutions often have an incentive to manipulate their records, and ZK proofs can be used to verify and retrieve data.

One of the challenges with ZK proofs is that it can take years to create them for machine learning or large language models (LLMs). This means that the model operator can tamper with the system or LLM to do things that are problematic. Dykstra believes that a decentralized, globally available database is needed to ensure that ZK proofs are created and maintained in a way that is efficient and secure.

Dykstra's most recent concern is that AI data is not really verifiable. He notes that efficient verification of AI data is crucial, and that building ZK proofs for machine learning or LLMs is necessary to ensure that they are executed correctly.

In a hypothetical scenario, Dykstra sees OpenAI as a community-owned and operated database for a journal, where journalists are creating content. This decentralized approach ensures that the database is always available and uncensorable, and that the data is secure and accurate.

Space and Time's solution to data manipulation and verification is a promising approach to the future of AI and blockchain technology. As the world becomes more reliant on data, it is crucial to have solutions in place that ensure its accuracy and security.

post_title: How Uber and the gig economy changed the way we live and work
title: The Gig Economy: A Shift in Work Structure and Its Impact
post_content:
The Gig Economy: A Shift in Work Structure and Its Impact

The gig economy, often interchanged with the sharing economy, is a modern-day labor market characterized by the prevalence of short-term contracts or freelance work as opposed to permanent jobs. While gig work has its roots in pre-internet times, the proliferation of low-cost broadband internet and smartphones has significantly expanded this labor sector. This article delves into the rise of the gig economy, focusing on Uber's role and the implications for workers and regulators.

The Gig Economy's Humble Beginnings

Before the advent of digital platforms, gig work was evident in traditional self-employment avenues such as plumbing and was also found in the classified ads of newspapers and, later, Craigslist and Backpage. The shift towards computer-based gig platforms like Mechanical Turk, Fiverr, and Elance was made possible by the widespread availability of the internet. However, it wasn't until the smartphone revolution that the gig economy truly took off, with every corner becoming a potential workspace and every task a possible gig.

A Perfect Storm

The rapid growth of the gig economy can be attributed to a combination of factors, including technological advancements and financial anxiety in the aftermath of the 2008 recession. With few job opportunities and economic uncertainty, people were compelled to explore alternative sources of income. This period also saw the rise of the "sharing economy," a term that initially evoked images of resource conservation and collaborative consumption. However, beneath this facade lay a more unsettling reality: the commoditization of skills and assets.

Uber: A Pioneer and Lightning Rod

Uber, a ride-sharing giant, has been at the forefront of the gig economy, capitalizing on this climate of financial instability and regulatory ambiguity. Known for its aggressive expansion tactics, Uber frequently entered markets without obtaining prior approval from regulators, leading to accusations of corporate recklessness. The company's questionable practices, including data privacy scandals, minimal surcharges, and a history of sexual harassment and discrimination allegations, have further tarnished its reputation.

The Impact on Traditional Employment: The Case of Taxi Medallions

The rise of Uber and other ride-sharing services has significantly affected traditional taxi industries. In many locales, taxi medallions functioned as de facto retirement plans for cab drivers, as their value would appreciate over time and could be sold to newcomers. However, the influx of ride-sharing services has caused medallion values to plummet, leaving many cab drivers with substantial debts from medallion purchases.

Compensation for affected drivers has varied across jurisdictions. For instance, Quebec pledged $250 million CAD in 2018 to compensate cab drivers, while Australian regulators applied a per-ride fee to ride-sharing services to offset the impact on medallion holders. In both cases, the burden has fallen on taxpayers and riders rather than the ride-sharing companies themselves.

The Erosion of Worker Protections and Benefits

The gig economy's reliance on independent contractors rather than employees has resulted in the loss of benefits and protections for workers. Uber, for example, has faced multiple lawsuits and investigations over wage theft and misclassification of workers. In response, the U.S. Department of Labor recently issued a final rule making it more challenging for gig economy companies to classify workers as independent contractors. Similarly, the European Union is considering a provisional deal to reclassify millions of app workers as employees.

The Future of the Gig Economy

The gig economy's impact on labor markets and worker protections remains a contentious issue. As more workers seek recognition as employees with benefits and consistent wages, companies like Uber will likely face increased scrutiny and regulatory pressure. Ultimately, finding a balance between the flexibility of gig work and the protections and benefits of traditional employment will be crucial in shaping the future of work.
meta_desc: Meta Description: "The gig economy has revolutionized the way workers find and access jobs. Learn about its origins, growth, and impact on traditional employment models. Discover the controversies surrounding gig companies like Uber and the measures taken to protect workers. Read on to understand the future of this modern labor market."

post_title: Watch: Sam Bankman-Friedâ€™s sentencing marks an end to the FTX saga
title: "Crypto Industry in Turmoil: SBF Sentencing Marks End of FTX Saga"
post_content:
The crypto industry has been going through a significant transformation lately, with the end of the last crypto winter and the return to a period of rising token prices and growing trading volume. However, the recent trial and conviction of former crypto baron Sam Bankman-Fried have cast a shadow over the industry, leaving many to question the ethical and moral decisions that led to such a drastic outcome.

The conviction of SBF, who was once a venture and political darling, has brought to light the dark side of the crypto world, forcing the industry to confront its own failings and shortcomings. The sentence of up to 25 years in prison is a stark reminder of the consequences of engaging in fraudulent and illegal activities, and a warning to others who may be tempted to follow in his footsteps.

As we reflect on the events that led to SBFâ€™s downfall, itâ€™s important to remember that the crypto industry is still a relatively new and evolving space. While there have been many successes, there have also been significant failures, and itâ€™s up to us as a community to learn from these mistakes and work towards building a more sustainable and responsible future for the industry.

In conclusion, SBFâ€™s conviction serves as a wake-up call for the crypto industry, reminding us of the importance of integrity, transparency, and accountability in our dealings with each other. As we move forward, let us strive to create a more ethical and sustainable industry that prioritizes the well-being of all its stakeholders.

post_title: Fisker loses customers' money, Robinhood launches a credit card, and Google generates travel itineraries
title: Top Tech Stories of the Week: EV Startups, Social Media Spying, and AI Travel Itineraries.
post_content:
Week in Review: Top Tech Stories of the Week

Welcome back to Week in Review, TechCrunch's newsletter rounding up the most significant events in the tech world over the past week. This edition is packed with stories that will leave you stunned, from EV startup Fisker's internal audit to Facebook's secret Snapchat snooping project.

Fisker's Financial Fiasco

Fisker, an electric vehicle (EV) startup, recently made headlines for all the wrong reasons. The company temporarily lost track of millions of dollars in customer payments as it scaled up deliveries, leading to an internal audit that began in December and took months to complete. This incident has caused a rift in the EV industry, with experts questioning Fisker's ability to operate efficiently and effectively.

Facebook's Secret Snapchat Traffic Snooping

In another shocking revelation, Facebook, the world's largest social media platform, was found to have been secretly spying on users' Snapchat traffic. Court documents have shown that the company was intercepting and decrypting the network traffic between users of the Snapchat app and its servers in a project known internally at Meta as "Project Ghostbusters." The goal of this operation was to gather intelligence on Snapchat's user base and potentially steal its market share.

Stability AI's Resignation of CEO

Finally, Stability AI, a startup known for its popular image generation tool Stable Diffusion, has announced the resignation of its founder and CEO, Emad Mostaque. This news comes amid an ongoing struggle for stability at the company, which was reportedly spending approximately $8 million a month as of October 2023 with little revenue to show for it. The resignation of Mostaque marks the end of an era for the company and raises questions about its future direction.

Other Tech News

While these three stories dominated the tech news this week, there were plenty of other developments worth exploring. For instance, Fisker's stock trading was temporarily suspended by the New York Stock Exchange due to its "abnormally low" stock levels. Meanwhile, Google added a new feature to its Search Generative Experience, allowing users to ask Google Search to plan a travel itinerary using AI.

In the world of funding, Copilot, a budgeting app, raised $6 million in a Series A round led by Nico Wittenborn's Adjacent. Additionally, Liquid Death, a canned water startup, raised $67 million in a recent fundraising round, bringing its total raised to more than $267 million.

Analysis and Podcasts

This week's Week in Review also includes an analysis piece by Ron looking at the parallels between Nvidia's and AWS' growth trajectories. As well as a podcast roundup featuring Equity, which discussed Robinhood's new credit card, Fisker's latest woes, and Databricks' new AI model. The Found podcast also spotlighted two companies building startups focused on kids, and the Chain Reaction podcast interviewed Scott Dykstra, CTO and co-founder of Space and Time.

Bonus Round

Finally, the bonus round includes news that Spotify is testing an online learning offering of freemium video courses, in an effort to get its 600 million+ users to spend more time and money on its platform.

In conclusion, this week's Week in Review is packed with exciting and unexpected news from the tech world. Whether you're interested in EV startups, social media spying, or AI-generated travel itineraries, there's something for everyone in this edition. Don't miss out on the most important stories in tech!
meta_desc: Fisker's Financial Fiasco and Facebook's Secret Snapchat Traffic Snooping Top Tech News of the Week

post_title: Microsoft Copilot has reportedly been blocked on all Congress-owned devices
title: Microsoft Copilot Blocked on Congress-Owned Devices
post_content:
The Changing Landscape of AI Tools in Government Operations

In a move that underscores the growing concerns around data security and privacy, the US Congress has taken a decisive step to restrict the use of certain AI-powered tools on government-issued devices. This development comes as part of a broader scrutiny of AI applications in sensitive governmental operations.

A New Directive

Recent reports indicate that the House Chief Administrative Officer has issued a directive that effectively bans the use of Microsoft's AI assistant, Copilot, on devices owned by the Congress. This decision was influenced by cybersecurity assessments that flagged potential risks associated with data leaks to cloud services not sanctioned by the House.

Implications for Congressional Staff

The prohibition means that while Congressional staff members are free to use Copilot on personal devices, its functionality will be disabled on all Windows devices under Congressional ownership. This measure reflects a cautious approach to new technologies, balancing innovation with the imperative of safeguarding institutional data.

Precedents and Privacy Concerns

This isn't the first time Congress has placed limitations on AI chatbots. Previously, the use of ChatGPT's free version was curtailed on House computers, although the paid version remained accessible due to its enhanced privacy features. The White House has also weighed in, establishing guidelines to ensure that AI tools employed by federal agencies protect American citizens' rights and safety.

Microsoft's Response and Future Plans

In response to these developments, Microsoft has acknowledged the necessity for heightened security measures for government users. The tech giant has unveiled plans for a suite of government-specific tools, including secure AI services for classified workloads. These offerings are designed to meet the stringent requirements of handling sensitive government data.

Looking Ahead

The House's administrative office is poised to review the government-tailored version of Copilot upon its release. This evaluation will determine the tool's suitability for integration into the Congressional workflow, taking into account the need for robust security protocols.

Conclusion

The intersection of AI technology and government operations is a complex domain, marked by the dual needs for innovation and security. As AI continues to evolve, so too will the policies governing its use, ensuring that advancements in technology serve the public interest without compromising the integrity of governmental functions.

post_title: Orbit Fab unveils $30K port to refuel satellites
title: Orbit Fab Launches $30K Port for Satellite Refueling in Space
post_content:
The Colorado-based startup, Orbit Fab, has revolutionized the space industry by launching an affordable and practical solution to in-space refueling. With its RAFTI (Rapidly Attachable Fluid Transfer Interface) docking mechanism, spacecraft can easily obtain propellant from an orbital tanker, extending their lifespan and providing a significant revenue boost for customers.

Orbit Fab was founded in 2018 by CEO Daniel Faber and has been in operation ever since. With a background in the space industry and experience in asteroid mining through his previous company, Deep Space Industries, Faber recognized the need for in-space refueling after conversations with colleagues and customers. The company's technology is based on the simple idea of equipping customer satellites with a refueling port while they are still on Earth, allowing one of Orbit Fab's tankers to deliver propellant directly to the customer's satellite for refueling.

The RAFTI docking mechanism is a critical component of Orbit Fab's technology, and the company has invested heavily in its development to ensure its safety, reliability, and effectiveness in the harsh space environment. After years of rigorous testing and certification, RAFTI has been flight-qualified and is now available on the market.

The potential market for in-space refueling is vast, with a growing number of space debris removal and satellite life extension companies like Astroscale. Orbit Fab's technology complements these capabilities, providing a practical solution for extending the lifespan of satellites and generating additional revenue for customers.

The company's first RAFTI-equipped satellites are expected to go into orbit this year, followed by the launch of the first fuel shuttle in 2025. Orbit Fab aims to sell 100 fueling ports this year, putting the RAFTI on a significant portion of satellites going to orbit. The company also has an agreement with an unnamed commercial customer to deliver a substantial quantity of fuel in the coming years.

Beyond these milestones, Orbit Fab has plans to upgrade RAFTI in the future, further expanding its capabilities and potential applications in the space industry. With its innovative technology and commitment to providing affordable and practical solutions for space exploration, Orbit Fab is set to revolutionize the way satellites are maintained and operated in orbit
meta_desc: "Revolutionize your space industry with Orbit Fab's RAFTI docking mechanism for in-space refueling. Contact us today to learn more!"
